intro: Triumfetta lanigera, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Triumfetta lanigera is often considered a weed but has medicinal properties in some traditional systems.
